_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Great Bend Coop Executive Summary-Fertilizer Branch
Prepared By: Dennis Neeland

1. The Facility Policy
The Management and Employees are committed to the prevention of any type of accidental release of NH3 or any other chemical that is stored at the facility. Company policy and procedures are strictly followed when handling and storing NH3.

2. Facility Information
The facility is located two miles south of Great Bend Kansas, however there are homes in the area. The facility activities involves storing dry, liquid, and NH3 fertilizers as well as bulk and packaged chemicals. The maximum NH3 storage at this facility is 38,000 gals contained in one 26,000 gallon tank and one 12,000 gallon tank.

3. The Worst Case and Alternate Release Scenario
Worst case scenario would release 121,503 pounds in a ten minute period or 12,150 pounds per minutewith a 1.02 mile endpoint.
The alternate release could involve a transfer hose rupture which would result in a release of 1450 pounds per minute in a 2 minute period for a total of 2900 pounds with a .22 mile to endpoint.

4. Accidental Release Prevention
The Great Bend Coop recognizes all safety regulations and procedures required by State and Federal Agencies and has annual training for the employees. The most common accidental release would be the overfilling of nurse trailers: An example would be a nurse trailer filled to 90% on a cool morning, as the air temperature rises, the product expands and causes the pressure relief valve to let product escape. Great Bend policy is not to fill above 85%.

5. Five Year Accident History
There has not been a reportable accident in the last five years.

6. Emergency Response Program
The Great Bend Coop has an Emergency Response Plan, Emergency Action Plan, and a Safety Director. All areas have worked with the County, City and Insurance Loss Control Department for the development of these plans.

7. Planned Safety Changes
The Company Safety Director, Operations Manager tour the Branch onc
e per month. All areas are toured once a quarter. Changes are made on an as needed basis as new regulations or concerns arise.
